1 a.definition: the period before attainment of majority

sub_terms.b: the state of being a minor

2.definition: the smaller of two groups constituting a whole

sub_terms.a: a group (as in a legislative body) having less than the number of votes necessary for control
sub_terms.b: a group of judges among those hearing an appeal who disagree with the majority's judgment
sub_terms.c: a group of jurisdictions taking a less widespread approach to or view of a legal question, issue, or problem

3 a.definition: a part of a population differing esp. from the dominant group in some characteristics (as race, sex, or national origin) and often subject to differential treatment

sub_terms.b: a member of a minority [an effort to hire more]
